meanings.definition: A person or thing that is unattractive or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: She saw a minger walking down the street.
meanings.sent2: The old sofa in the corner was a real minger.
meanings.sent3: The minger of a painting made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house was a minger, with its broken windows and overgrown garden.
meanings.sent5: The garbage dump was a minger, with its piles of trash and foul smell.

meanings.definition: To make a face indicating disgust or displeasure.
meanings.sent1: He couldn't help but minger at the sight of the spoiled milk.
meanings.sent2: She mingered when she tasted the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent3: The toddler would always minger when offered vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The actor had to minger on cue during the play.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's exaggerated minger had the audience in stitches.
